qas.question: From where does most asphalt come?
What are the sources of natural deposits of asphalt?
How much heat is required for the natural production of asphalt?
Besides heat, what other requirement is needed to form asphalt?
What other product of heat and pressure does the formation of asphalt and petroleum  produce?
Most of the petroleum used for commercial purposes is obtained from what?
Current living things are the source of what?
What product of heat and pressure does the formation of asphalt and microscopic algae produce?
Besides pressure, what is required to form mud?
Besides heat, what is required to form Besides pressure, what is required to form mud??

context: The great majority of <b5_0>asphalt<b5_0/> used commercially is obtained from <a0_0>petroleum<a0_0/>. Nonetheless, large amounts of asphalt occur in concentrated form in nature. <b6_0>Naturally occurring deposits<b6_0/> of asphalt/bitumen are formed from the remains of ancient, microscopic algae (diatoms) and other <a1_0>once-living things<a1_0/>. These remains were deposited in the mud on the bottom of the ocean or lake where the organisms lived. Under the <b8_0>heat<b8_0/> (<a2_0>above 50 °C<a2_0/>) and <a3_0><b9_0>pressure<b9_0/><a3_0/> of burial deep in the earth, the remains were transformed into materials such as asphalt/bitumen, <a4_0><b7_0>kerogen<b7_0/><a4_0/>, or petroleum.
